articles.title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
articles.description:
"My money would be on March 1 for him.”

summary: Bill Simmons predicts Jayson Tatum's return to the Celtics on March 1.
Tatum's absence affects the team's performance as they compete for playoff positioning.
Celtics fans are eager for Tatum's return to boost the team's chances.

articles.title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
articles.description:
The officer has been released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital to recover from his injuries at home, state police said.

summary: State Police trooper injured after cruiser was struck on North Shore highway.
Trooper has been released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital to recover at home.
Incident raises concerns about highway safety for Boston commuters.

articles.description:

Boston residents celebrate local athlete's achievement in international sports.

articles.title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
articles.description:
The couple apparently fell through ice in Eastham on Feb. 14 while walking their dog, police and fire officials said.

summary: Couple fell through ice in Eastham on February 14 while walking their dog.
Woman was found dead; search for her husband has been suspended.
Incident raises concerns about ice safety for Boston area residents.

articles.title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
articles.description:
"When we had an injury at first base his unwillingness to play that position was extremely discouraging.”

summary: Tom Werner expressed disappointment in Rafael Devers' refusal to play first base during injuries.
Devers' unwillingness to adapt could affect team dynamics and fan support in 2026.
Boston Red Sox management may reconsider player roles impacting local fan engagement.

articles.title: More sunshine on the way Tuesday. Rain and snow expected on Wednesday.
articles.description:
We have now transitioned from mid-winter to late winter. This is the time when the days often result in more melting of snow and ice with a refreezing at night.

The post More sunshine on the way Tuesday. Rain and snow expected on Wednesday. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Expect sunny weather in Boston on Tuesday, February 16.
Rain and snow forecasted for Wednesday, February 17.
Residents should prepare for melting snow and potential refreezing overnight.

articles.description:
